revised_title: Effects of Residual Impurities on High Temperature Ductility and Crack Growth in CrMoV Steels
tldr: This article investigates the effects of residual impurity elements, such as arsenic, tin, and antimony, on the high-temperature ductility and crack growth in CrMoV steels. The study finds that these impurities reduce the cohesive strength of prior austenite grain boundaries, promoting intergranular embrittlement. The research also highlights the importance of grain refinement and microstructure control in preventing embrittlement and improving material properties.
